params.data: The resulting data from the call. This is error data when the call was not a success. Otherwise,                this is malformed data when the call was a success.
params.success: If the call to the token was a success.

deposit(address,uint256,address).details: Wraps aTokens in a StaticAToken wrapper a deposits the resulting tokens into the Alchemist.

params.amount: The amount of aTokens to wrap.
params.recipient: The account in the `alchemist` that will recieve the resulting static aTokens.
params.yieldToken: The address of the static aToken wrapper.

returns.sharesIssued: The amount of shares issued in the `alchemist` to the account owned by `recipient`.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

renounceOwnership().details: Leaves the contract without owner. It will not be possible to call `onlyOwner` functions anymore. Can only be called by the current owner. NOTE: Renouncing ownership will leave the contract without an owner, thereby removing any functionality that is only available to the owner.

transferOwnership(address).details: Transfers ownership of the contract to a new account (`newOwner`). Can only be called by the current owner.

withdraw(address,uint256,address).details: Withdraws StaticATokens from the Alchemist and unwraps them into aTokens.

params.recipient: The account that will receive the resulting aTokens.
params.shares: The amount of shares to withdraw from the `alchemist`.
params.yieldToken: The address of the static aToken wrapper.

returns.amountWithdrawn: The amount of aTokens withdrawn to `recipient`.

ERC20CallFailed(address,bool,bytes).notice: An error used to indicate that a call to an ERC20 contract failed.

IllegalState(string).notice: An error used to indicate that a function has encountered an unrecoverable state.

Unauthorized(string).notice: An error used to indicate that a message sender tried to execute a privileged function.

whitelist().notice: The address of the whitelist contract.
